name: Count On with Objects within 10
description: Begin at a known addend and count on with manipulatives to find totals within ten.

name: Count On with Number Lines within 20
description: Use number lines to count on from the larger addend to solve addition within twenty.

name: Solve Counting-On Equations within 20
description: Write and solve addition equations that leverage counting-on strategies within twenty.

name: Compose Ten with Objects
description: Rearrange addends using manipulatives to make ten before adding the remaining ones.

name: Make Ten on Number Lines
description: Use number line jumps to bridge to ten and complete addition within twenty.

name: Decompose Addends to Make Ten
description: Split addends and write equations that show making ten before combining remaining ones.

name: Recall Doubles Facts within 20
description: Fluently recall addition doubles facts up to ten plus ten.

name: Use Near Doubles to Add
description: Adjust known doubles facts by one to solve near-double sums within twenty.

name: Represent Near Doubles with Equations
description: Write equations that model doubling and adjusting to solve addition problems.

name: Build Addition/Subtraction Fact Families
description: Create fact families for addition and subtraction within twenty using models.

name: Complete Fact Families within 20
description: Fill in missing equations in addition/subtraction fact families within twenty.

name: Use Commutative Property to Add within 20
description: Show that a + b = b + a with models and equations to solve sums efficiently.

name: Group Addends to Add within 20
description: Use the associative property to regroup addends and make ten or doubles when adding within twenty.

name: Add Three Numbers within 20
description: Add three whole numbers within twenty using make-ten or doubles strategies.

name: Find the Unknown Number in ± Equations
description: Solve addition and subtraction equations to twenty with a symbol for the unknown in any position.

name: Apply Fact Families to Stories
description: Use fact family relationships to solve addition and subtraction story problems.

name: Model Two-Digit Addition with Regrouping
description: Use base-ten blocks to add two-digit numbers including regrouping ten ones for a ten.

name: Use Place-Value Strategies for Two-Digit Addition
description: Break apart tens and ones or use compensation to add within 100 efficiently.

name: Solve Two-Digit Addition Word Problems
description: Apply place-value addition strategies to word problems within 100.

name: Subtract with Objects within 10
description: Model subtraction by removing objects from a set within ten.

name: Subtract on Number Lines within 20
description: Use backward jumps on number lines to model subtraction within twenty.

name: Write Subtraction Equations within 20
description: Represent take-away situations with subtraction equations and solve within twenty.

name: Count Back within 10
description: Count back by ones to subtract within ten using objects or number lines.

name: Count Up to Find Differences
description: Start from the smaller number and count up to find the difference within twenty.

name: Choose Count-Back or Count-Up Strategies
description: Decide whether to count back or count up to solve subtraction situations efficiently.

name: Relate Addition and Subtraction with Models
description: Use inverse relationships to show how addition and subtraction undo each other.

name: Complete Subtraction Fact Families
description: Fill in missing subtraction equations given a fact family within twenty.

name: Explain Fact Family Reasoning
description: Justify subtraction solutions by referencing the related addition facts.

name: Model Two-Digit Subtraction with Regrouping
description: Use base-ten blocks to subtract within 100, regrouping tens into ones when needed.

name: Use Place-Value Strategies for Subtraction within 100
description: Decompose numbers into tens and ones or use compensation to subtract within 100.

name: Solve Two-Digit Subtraction Word Problems
description: Apply place-value subtraction strategies to story problems within 100.

name: Build Fluency with Addition Facts to 10
description: Practice rapid recall of single-digit addition facts up to sums of ten.

name: Build Fluency with Addition Facts to 20
description: Recall single-digit addition facts with sums up to twenty using games and drills.

name: Monitor Addition Strategies for Fluency
description: Self-check and adjust strategies when working toward addition fact fluency.

name: Build Fluency with Subtraction Facts to 10
description: Practice rapid recall of subtraction facts with differences up to ten.

name: Build Fluency with Subtraction Facts to 20
description: Recall single-digit subtraction facts with minuends up to twenty.

name: Monitor Subtraction Strategies for Fluency
description: Evaluate accuracy and adjust strategies while working toward subtraction fact fluency.

name: Identify Even and Odd Numbers with Models
description: Use pairing and arrays to determine if numbers are even or odd within fifty.

name: Use Even/Odd Rules in Addition
description: Predict whether sums are even or odd by analyzing addend parity.

name: Explain Even/Odd Patterns
description: Use repeated reasoning to explain parity patterns in tables and charts.

name: Quickly Recall Make-Ten Pairs
description: Develop automatic recall of number pairs that sum to ten.

name: Apply Make-Ten to Solve Addition
description: Use make-ten facts to compute sums within twenty efficiently.

name: Use Make-Ten for Subtraction
description: Transform subtraction problems using complementary make-ten facts.

name: Solve Mixed Addition/Subtraction within 20
description: Apply fact fluency to mixed addition and subtraction problems within twenty.

name: Choose Efficient Strategies within 20
description: Select from counting-on, make-ten, doubles, or fact recall to solve problems quickly.

name: Apply Fact Fluency to Word Problems within 20
description: Use fluent facts to solve and explain addition/subtraction story problems.

name: Create Equal Groups with Objects
description: Partition sets into equal groups and identify the number of groups and items.

name: Model Multiplication with Arrays
description: Use rectangular arrays to represent repeated addition situations.

name: Relate Repeated Addition to Multiplication
description: Write repeated addition and multiplication expressions for equal groups.

name: Write Multiplication Sentences for Arrays
description: Translate equal groups and arrays into multiplication equations.

name: Compute Multiplication within 100
description: Use strategies such as skip-counting and arrays to multiply single-digit factors.

name: Explain Multiplication Models
description: Describe how arrays, equal groups, and number lines represent multiplication situations.

name: Find Unknown Factors or Quotients
description: Solve multiplication and division equations with an unknown number using arrays and fact families.

name: Share Sets Equally
description: Divide a total into equal shares and interpret the quotient and remainder.

name: Write Division Equations for Sharing
description: Represent sharing situations with division equations and interpret unknowns.

name: Relate Sharing to Multiplication
description: Explain how division sharing situations connect to related multiplication facts.

name: Skip Count by Factors
description: Skip count by 2s, 3s, 4s, 5s, and 10s to support multiplication facts.

name: Find Missing Multiples in Skip-Counting Sequences
description: Identify and fill missing numbers in skip-counting patterns for key factors.

name: Use Skip-Counting in Word Problems
description: Apply skip-counting to solve real-world multiplication situations.

name: Decompose Multiples of 10 for Multiplication
description: Break multiples of ten into tens and ones to prepare for multiplication.

name: Multiply Single-Digit Numbers by Multiples of 10
description: Use place-value patterns to multiply single-digit factors by multiples of ten.

name: Use the Distributive Property with Multiples of 10
description: Break apart factors to multiply numbers like 6 × 30 using distributive reasoning.

name: Use the Commutative Property for Multiplication Facts
description: Apply the commutative property to derive unknown multiplication facts.

name: Use Doubling and Halving Strategies
description: Leverage doubles and halving to compute multiplication facts efficiently.

name: Use Area Models for Multiplication Facts
description: Interpret products using area models to reinforce fact strategies.

name: Use Identity and Zero Properties of Multiplication
description: Explain and use 1×a=a and 0×a=0 to reason about multiplication facts.

name: Use Related Multiplication Facts for Division
description: Leverage known multiplication facts to determine quotients quickly.

name: Divide Using Repeated Subtraction
description: Interpret division facts as repeated subtraction and verify quotients.

name: Divide Using Area Models
description: Partition arrays to interpret division facts and confirm related multiplication.

name: Complete Multiplication/Division Fact Families
description: Fill in missing values in fact families connecting multiplication and division.

name: Generate Fact Families from Models
description: Use arrays and equal groups to produce related multiplication and division equations.

name: Apply Fact Families in Context
description: Solve story problems by leveraging known fact family relationships.

name: Build Fluency with Mixed Multiplication and Division Facts
description: Respond quickly to mixed multiplication and division facts within 10 × 10.

name: Monitor Strategies During Mixed Fact Practice
description: Self-assess strategy use and accuracy for mixed multiplication/division drills.

name: Apply Mixed Facts to Story Problems
description: Choose appropriate multiplication or division facts to solve context problems.

name: Model Multi-Digit Multiplication with Area Models
description: Use area models or base-ten blocks to multiply a two-digit number by a two-digit number.

name: Use Partial Products for Multi-Digit Multiplication
description: Decompose factors and record partial products to multiply within 1,000.

name: Apply the Standard Algorithm for Multiplication
description: Multiply multi-digit numbers using the standard algorithm and explain regrouping.

name: Model Long Division with Base-Ten Blocks
description: Partition base-ten blocks into equal groups to model division with two-digit divisors.

name: Use Partial Quotients for Long Division
description: Apply partial quotient reasoning to divide by one- and two-digit divisors.

name: Apply the Standard Algorithm for Division
description: Execute long division with remainders and interpret results in context.

name: Use the Distributive Property over Addition
description: Break apart factors and apply distributive reasoning to simplify multiplication.

name: Use the Associative Property to Reorder Factors
description: Regroup factors to streamline multiplication and division calculations.

name: Factor Numbers to Support Multiplication and Division
description: Decompose numbers into factors to simplify multi-step computations.

name: Analyze Two-Step Word Problems
description: Identify operations and intermediate steps needed to solve multi-step problems.

name: Write Equations with Letters for Word Problems
description: Represent multi-step situations with equations that use symbols for unknowns.

name: Evaluate Reasonableness of Solutions
description: Use estimation and inverse operations to check multi-step answers for reasonableness.

name: Create Equal Groups to Model Division
description: Form groups of a given size to determine the quotient and interpret remainders.

name: Use Number Lines for Repeated Subtraction
description: Interpret division as repeated jumps on number lines to find quotients.

name: Write Division Equations for Grouping
description: Express grouping scenarios with division equations and unknowns.

name: Relate Division to Multiplication with Area Models
description: Use arrays and area models to show how division undoes multiplication.

name: Explain Division/Multiplication Fact Relationships
description: Use fact families to justify division answers using multiplication.

name: Choose Related Fact Strategies
description: Decide which multiplication facts help solve a division problem efficiently.

name: Interpret Division Situations
description: Distinguish between equal sharing and grouping scenarios in word problems.

name: Solve Division Word Problems
description: Use multiplication or division strategies to solve real-world problems with unknowns.

name: Explain Division Solutions
description: Communicate strategies, quotients, and remainders using words and equations.

name: Solve Join and Separate Word Problems
description: Represent and solve addition/subtraction situations with unknown parts or totals.

name: Solve Compare Word Problems
description: Use bar models or number lines to solve comparison situations.

name: Choose Strategies for Additive Problems
description: Decide whether to add or subtract and select appropriate representations.

name: Solve Comparison Word Problems with Unknowns
description: Represent unknown start, change, or result in comparison situations.

name: Interpret Language in Comparison Problems
description: Analyze words like more, fewer, and difference to map comparison structures.

name: Draw Models for Comparison Situations
description: Use tape diagrams or bar models to represent comparison problems.

name: Interpret Equal Groups Word Problems
description: Determine whether contexts require multiplication or division solutions.

name: Solve Equal Groups Problems with Multiplication
description: Use multiplication strategies to solve equal groups problems within 100.

name: Solve Equal Groups Problems with Division
description: Apply division strategies to equal groups problems including remainders.

name: Plan Solution Steps for Two-Step Problems
description: Sequence operations needed to solve two-step situations.

name: Solve and Record Two-Step Problems
description: Compute two-step solutions and represent each step with equations.

name: Check Two-Step Solutions
description: Use estimation or inverse operations to verify multi-step answers.

name: Find Factors of Whole Numbers
description: List all factor pairs for numbers up to 100 using arrays and division.

name: Identify Multiples of Whole Numbers
description: Use skip-counting and multiplication facts to determine multiples within 1,000.

name: Determine if Numbers Are Prime or Composite
description: Analyze factor sets to classify numbers as prime or composite.

name: Generate Numerical Patterns
description: Create patterns using rules involving addition or multiplication.

name: Describe Pattern Features
description: Explain relationships between pattern terms using verbal descriptions and equations.

name: Graph Patterns on Coordinate Grids
description: Plot pattern terms on coordinate axes to visualize growth.

name: Evaluate Expressions with Parentheses
description: Apply order of operations with parentheses to compute numerical expressions.

name: Write Numerical Expressions from Verbal Descriptions
description: Translate words into numerical expressions using parentheses and multiple operations.

name: Compare Numerical Expressions Without Evaluating
description: Use structural reasoning to compare the value of expressions.

name: Write Equations with Letters for Unknowns
description: Represent arithmetic relationships using letters and understand equality.

name: Solve Simple Equations
description: Use inverse operations to solve one-step equations with whole numbers.

name: Graph and Interpret Inequalities
description: Represent solutions to inequalities on number lines and interpret them in context.

name: Rewrite Subtraction as Unknown-Addend
description: Solve subtraction by writing an equivalent unknown-addend equation.

name: Decompose Numbers to 10
description: Show numbers to ten as pairs in multiple ways using manipulatives and drawings.

name: Add and Subtract Fluently within 5
description: Develop automaticity with addition and subtraction facts within five using bead stair, fingers, and ten-frames.

name: Identify Arithmetic Patterns in Tables
description: Find and explain addition and multiplication patterns in tables and on the hundred chart.
